cool_clock

Class CoolClockTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • cool_clock.CoolClockTimer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class CoolClockTimer
extends java.util.TimerTask
    A custom TimerTask that keeps track of the time and settings, running every second. This class also uses the GUI Control object to display the information and get input from the user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CoolClockTimer()
      Constructor which sets variables and creates a new instance of Control for display purposes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Converts seconds into the clock format

      Updates the display according to the current time and display settings
      void run()
      This function is called every second by a Timer.
      void toggleHourFormat()
      Switches the military time flag to it's opposite
      void togglePause()
      Switches the pause flag to it's opposite
      java.lang.String TwelveHourPm()
      Returns the appropriate string to print on the display based on the current time and hour format (military_time)

        cancel, scheduledExecutionTime

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoolClockTimer

        public CoolClockTimer()
        Constructor which sets variables and creates a new instance of Control for display purposes.
        Postcondition:
        time is set to 0, military_time is set to true, pause is set to false, new Control instance myGUI instantiated

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This function is called every second by a Timer. It calls refresh to update the display to the current state of the clock then adds 1 second to the time.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class java.util.TimerTask
        Postcondition:
        the display reflects the status of the clock at the time this function was called and the time has been incremented by 1 second.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Updates the display according to the current time and display settings
        Postcondition:
        display is refreshed to reflect the current time and settings

      • togglePause

        public void togglePause()
        Switches the pause flag to it's opposite
        Postcondition:
        pause is set to the opposite value

      • toggleHourFormat

        public void toggleHourFormat()
        Switches the military time flag to it's opposite
        Postcondition:
        military_time is set to the opposite value

      • ConvertSeconds

        public int[] ConvertSeconds()
        Converts seconds into the clock format
        Returns:
        integer array that represents each digit of the clock

      • TwelveHourPm

        public java.lang.String TwelveHourPm()
        Returns the appropriate string to print on the display based on the current time and hour format (military_time)
        Returns:
        the appropriate string to print

      • addTime

        public void addTime(int amt)
        Takes in a change in the time and converts that into seconds
        Parameters:
        amt - the change in time
        Postcondition:
        the time is shifted by amt seconds and is still in the valid second range (0-86399)
